definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: It takes away our edge, makes us groggy, and disrupts our sleep.
sentences.chinese: 它让我们反应迟钝，头昏脑胀，扰乱我们的睡眠。

sentences.english: They perturbed good social order with their rumours.
sentences.chinese: 他们用谣言扰乱了良好的社会秩序。

sentences.english: And these greenhouse gases perturb the radiation balance of climate.
sentences.chinese: 这些温室气体会扰乱气候的辐射平衡。

sentences.english: Corporate sprawl distracts managers, diverts resources and muddies valuations.
sentences.chinese: 公司扩张吸引管理层，转移资源和扰乱估价。

sentences.english: He was bound over to keep the peace by magistrates.
sentences.chinese: 治安官命他具结保证不扰乱治安。

sentences.english: Tom was upsetting the other children, so I showed him the door。
sentences.chinese: 汤姆一直在扰乱别的孩子，我就把他撵了出去。

sentences.english: This disrupts traffic, making people think that something big is happening, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 这扰乱了交通，使人们认为正发生着一些大事情。

sentences.english: Now the Spirit of the LORD had departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from the LORD tormented him.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华的灵离开扫罗，有恶魔从耶和华那里来扰乱他。

sentences.english: The person who disturbed the peace should be punished.
sentences.chinese: 扰乱治安的人应该受到惩罚。

sentences.english: Can he mess up your plans without you becoming resentful?
sentences.chinese: 你是否可以让他扰乱你的原订计划，而毫不怨忿？

sentences.english: The children continually disturbed the class.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们不停地扰乱课堂。

sentences.english: I was disturbed by he pitter-patter of rain on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 屋顶上淅淅沥沥的雨声扰乱了我的思绪。

sentences.english: The spokesman was completely discombobulated by the hecklers.
sentences.chinese: 发言人完全被诘问者扰乱了。

sentences.english: I only could curse on devil of excuse our hearts with peaceful.
sentences.chinese: 我只能咒骂，咒骂扰乱我们宁静心田的怪兽与狰狞。

sentences.english: The “patriotic re-education, ” for example, interrupted the normal order of temples.
sentences.chinese: 例如“爱国主义再教育”扰乱了寺庙的正常秩序。

sentences.english: The visitor opened the wrong door and broke in on  a private conference.
sentences.chinese: 那名来访者开错了门，突然扰乱了一个秘密会议。

definition: to mess up/to mismanage/to bungle/to confuse/to muddle
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to endanger/to jeopardize/a danger (to life, national security etc)
